item.title: Decentralized Food Delivery Service
item.description:
All the Pieces

Here are all the pieces required to operate a food delivery service:

Client App(s)

This is required for discovery of all the restaurants/food providers around the area. They integrate checkout/payment options and provide order flow, they differentiate on the basis of selection they offer and the partners they integrate on the back-end

Listing Partners

They are responsible for aggregating restaurant information on-ground. Restaurant KYC, Menu creation, Price listing are all done in accordance to protocols. They get paid by client apps for sharing their information. They differentiate on the basis of the depth + quality of their catalog.

Logistics Providers

They provide A -> B logistics between restaurants and users. These are the easiest to imagine as many of them already exist. They get paid by the client app for providing this service. They differentiate on the basis of

Party Responsibility Primary User Differentiated on
Client Apps Discovery of restaurants in the area, integrate payment/checkout options End User Selection they provide, how they market
Listing Partners Aggregate restaurant information on ground such as Restaurant info, menu, prices Client Apps Depth + Quality of their catalog
Logistics Providers Provide A -> B logistics between restaurants and users Client Apps Quality + Speed of service
Restaurant PoS Provides order information to restaurants

item.title: Hello World
item.description:
What is Decenter?

Decentralization is breaking my brain.

Here is an attempt to understand decentralization and its consequences. In this blog, I will try to untangle what decentralization means, how is it different from centralized systems.
